text: Wab Kinew is a Canadian politician and the 25th Premier of Manitoba. He was born on December 31, 1981, in Ontario, Canada. Kinew is a member of the New Democratic Party of Manitoba (NDP) and has been serving as the Premier of Manitoba since October 2023. == Early Life and Education == Wab Kinew was born to Dr. Tobasonakwut Kinew and Dr. Kathi Avery Kinew. He is from the Onigaming First Nation in northwestern Ontario. Kinew holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in economics from the University of Manitoba and a Master's degree in Indigenous Governance from the University of Winnipeg. == Career == Before entering politics, Kinew worked as a broadcaster and an administrator at the University of Winnipeg. He is also a bestselling author and an honorary witness of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. === Political career === Kinew was first elected as the Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA) for Fort Rouge in 2016. In 2017, he became the leader of the Manitoba NDP and the leader of the official opposition. He became the Premier of Manitoba in October 2023. == Personal life == Wab Kinew is married and has three children. He is known for his commitment to Indigenous rights and reconciliation. == References == Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:Premiers of Manitoba Category:First Nations people
title: Wab Kinew
